title: Quicksilver (1-13) + Annual (1997-1998) [Marvel]
description:
English | CBR | 14 Issues

Quicksilver #1-13 + Heroes for Hire / Quicksilver '98
Publisher:  Marvel
Publication Date:  November 1997 - November 1998

Writer:  Tom Peyer (#1-6), Joe Edkin (#5-13), John Ostrander (#7-12)
Penciler:  Rob Haynes (#1, 3), Casey Jones (#1-3), Hector Collazo (#3), Derec Aucoin (#4-6, 8, 10-12), Alex Morrissey (#6), Ivan Reis (#7, 9), Chris Renaud (#11, 13)
Inker:  Jason Martin (#1-3, 5), Harry Candelario (#3), Rich Faber (#4-5, 8, 10-12), Ralph Cabrera (#6), Al Milgrom (#6), Randy Emberlin (#7, 9), Mark Lipka (#11), Scott Elmer (#11-13), Don Hillsman (#12), Hector Collazo (#12), Harry Candelario (#12
Colorist:  Joe Rosas (#1, 4-6, 8-13), Paul Becton (#2-3, 12), Joe Andreani (#7), Kevin Tinsley (#12)
Letterer:  Albert Deschesne (#1, 3-7, 8-13), Richard Starkings (#1-7, 9-13), and Kolja Fuchs (#3)

In the wake of Onslaught, Quicksilver makes his way to Wundagore Mountain to be reunited with his daughter, Luna, but arrives just as the High Evolutionary's base is being attacked by the Acolytes who have been sent by Exodus to take the mysterious Isotope E; Quicksilver joins the battle and helps the Knights of Wundagore protect their master but the High Evolutionary decides to take Isotope E and retreat from his home, leaving it in the hands of Exodus and the Acolytes; With the High Evolutionary planning on taking off alone to do his work in secret, he makes Quicksilver the leader of the Knights of Wundagore.

Thanks goes to Gambit, Kritter, Shameless Scanner, and rougher for this release.
